contextId.information: This means that Paul did not say both that he would visit and that he would not visit at the same time. The words "yes" and "no" are repeated for emphasis. AT: "so that I say 'Yes, I will certainly visit' and 'No, I will definitely not visit' at the same time" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: so that I say "Yes, yes" and "No, no" at the same time

contextId.information: Jesus says "Yes" concerning the promises of God, which means that he guarantees that they are true. AT: "For the Son of God ... does not say "Yes" and "No" concerning God's promises. Instead, he always says "Yes" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: For the Son of God ... is not "Yes" and "No." Instead, he is always "Yes."

contextId.information: This means that Jesus guarantees all of God's promises. AT: "all the promises of God are guaranteed in Jesus Christ" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: all the promises of God are "Yes" in him

contextId.information: This refers to another letter that Paul had written to the Corinthian Christians that no longer exists. AT: "I wrote as I did in my previous letter" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: I wrote as I did

contextId.information: Possible meanings are 1) "you are obedient to God in everything" or 2) "you are obedient in everything that I have taught you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: you are obedient in everything

contextId.information: Here the word "anything" refers to anything pertaining to Paul's apostolic ministry. AT: "to claim that anything we have done in ministry comes from our own efforts" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: to claim anything as coming from us

contextId.information: "the ministry of death." This refers to the Old Testament law that God gave through Moses. AT: "the ministry that causes death because it is based on the law" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: the service that produced

contextId.information: "the ministry of condemnation." This refers to the Old Testament law. AT: "the ministry that condemns people because it is based on the law" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: the service of condemnation

contextId.information: The refers to the glory that shined on Moses' face. AT: "the glory on Moses' face as it faded away completely" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: the ending of a glory that was passing away

contextId.information: This phrase explains how Paul and his coworkers "have this ministry." It is a gift that God has given to them through his mercy. AT: "because God has shown us mercy" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: and just as we have received mercy

contextId.information: Here the words "the one" refer to God. AT: "God who raised the Lord Jesus from death to life" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: the one who raised the Lord Jesus

contextId.information: This refers to their physical bodies decaying and dying. AT: "our physical bodies are getting weak and dying" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: outwardly we are wasting away

contextId.information: Possible meanings are 1) "we persuade people of the truth of the gospel" or 2) "we persuade people that we are legitimate apostles." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: we persuade people

contextId.information: Possible meanings for "outside" are 1) "outside of our bodies" or 2) "outside of the church." The word "inside" refers to their inward emotions. AT: "by conflicts with other people and by fears within ourselves" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: by conflicts on the outside and fears on the inside

contextId.information: This kind of sorrow leads to death instead of salvation because it does not produce repentance. AT: "Worldly sorrow, however, leads to spiritual death" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Worldly sorrow, however, brings about death

contextId.information: Paul is referring to the collection of money from the Corinthians for the believers in Jerusalem. AT: "who had encouraged your giving in the first place" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: who had already begun this task

contextId.information: Paul is encouraging the Corinthians to give generously by comparing them with the generosity of the Macedonian churches. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: by comparing it to the eagerness of other people

contextId.information: This refers to collecting money for the believers in Jerusalem. AT: "For this task of collecting money" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: For this task

contextId.information: Paul is referring to his asking Titus to return to Corinth and complete the collection. AT: "For he not only agreed to our request that he help you with the collection" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: For he not only accepted our appeal

contextId.information: This refers to the collection of money to give to the believers in Jerusalem. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "the ministry for the believers in Jerusalem" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: the ministry for the believers

contextId.information: Here the word "service" refers to Paul and his companions bringing the contribution to the believers in Jerusalem. AT: "For our carrying out this service for the believers in Jerusalem" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: For carrying out this service

contextId.information: "I have never in any way been a financial burden to you." Paul speaks of someone for whom one has to spend money as if they were heavy items that people have to carry. The full meaning of this can be made explicit. AT: "I have done all I can to make sure you do not have to spend money so that I can be with you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: In everything I have kept myself from being a burden to you

contextId.information: The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "and in danger from people who claimed to be brothers in Christ, but who betrayed us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: in danger from false brothers

contextId.information: The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "What I want is that you love and accept me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: I want you
